Class CryptoManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • CryptoManager

  • public class CryptoManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    hudson This class demonstrates two different methods for encoding and decoding a string of characters entered by a user, as well as a method for determining whether the string entered is out of the range of the ASCII codes from 32 to 95.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static char LOWER_BOUND 
      private static int RANGE 
      private static char UPPER_BOUND

      Decrypts a string according the Bellaso Cipher.
      static java.lang.String decryptCaesar(java.lang.String encryptedText, int key)
      Decrypts a string according to the Caesar Cipher.
      static java.lang.String encryptBellaso(java.lang.String plainText, java.lang.String bellasoStr)
      Encrypts a string according the Bellaso Cipher.
      static java.lang.String encryptCaesar(java.lang.String plainText, int key)
      Encrypts a string according to the Caesar Cipher.
      static boolean stringInBounds(java.lang.String plainText)
      This method determines if a string is within the allowable bounds of ASCII codes according to the LOWER_BOUND and UPPER_BOUND characters

    • Method Detail

      • stringInBounds

        public static boolean stringInBounds(java.lang.String plainText)
        This method determines if a string is within the allowable bounds of ASCII codes according to the LOWER_BOUND and UPPER_BOUND characters
        Parameters:
        plainText - a string to be encrypted, if it is within the allowable bounds
        Returns:
        true if all characters are within the allowable bounds, false if any character is outside

      • encryptCaesar

        public static java.lang.String encryptCaesar(java.lang.String plainText,
                                             int key)
        Encrypts a string according to the Caesar Cipher. The integer key specifies an offset and each character in plainText is replaced by the character \"offset\" away from it
        Parameters:
        plainText - an uppercase string to be encrypted.
        key - an integer that specifies the offset of each character
        Returns:
        the encrypted string

      • encryptBellaso

        public static java.lang.String encryptBellaso(java.lang.String plainText,
                                              java.lang.String bellasoStr)
        Encrypts a string according the Bellaso Cipher. Each character in plainText is offset according to the ASCII value of the corresponding character in bellasoStr, which is repeated to correspond to the length of plainText
        Parameters:
        plainText - an uppercase string to be encrypted.
        bellasoStr - an uppercase string that specifies the offsets, character by character.
        Returns:
        the encrypted string

      • decryptCaesar

        public static java.lang.String decryptCaesar(java.lang.String encryptedText,
                                             int key)
        Decrypts a string according to the Caesar Cipher. The integer key specifies an offset and each character in encryptedText is replaced by the character \"offset\" characters before it. This is the inverse of the encryptCaesar method.
        Parameters:
        encryptedText - an encrypted string to be decrypted.
        key - an integer that specifies the offset of each character
        Returns:
        the plain text string

      • decryptBellaso

        public static java.lang.String decryptBellaso(java.lang.String encryptedText,
                                              java.lang.String bellasoStr)
        Decrypts a string according the Bellaso Cipher. Each character in encryptedText is replaced by the character corresponding to the character in bellasoStr, which is repeated to correspond to the length of plainText. This is the inverse of the encryptBellaso method.
        Parameters:
        encryptedText - an uppercase string to be encrypted.
        bellasoStr - an uppercase string that specifies the offsets, character by character.
        Returns:
        the decrypted string
